abstract: Sony locks almost 100,000 online user accounts in its PlayStation Network hit by unauthorized log-in attempts; notifies owners of Bravia flat panel televisions that sets contain a defect that could cause them to melt and offers free repair.
snippet: The Japanese company said that it had locked almost 100,000 user accounts on its PlayStation Network, but believed few of the accounts had actually been accessed.
lead_paragraph: The Japanese company said that it had locked almost 100,000 user accounts on its PlayStation Network, but believed few of the accounts had actually been accessed.

headline.main: Sony Freezes Gaming Accounts After Hacking Attack
headline.print_headline: Sony Struggling With Online Attack and a TV Defect
